I have received from the Iron and Steel WireManufacturers Association an application for an enquiry undertne Safeguarding of Industries procedure in regard to iron andsteel wire of all kinds. A similar application was made in 1S25 as part of thegeneral application by the iron and steel industry, and againas a separate application at the beginning of 1926. this latter was considered by the Cabinet, and I was authorised to reply (cab.6(26) Con. 10) that the Governments decision inregard to the application of the steel industry would applyalso to the sectional applications then under consideration,:(The other sectional application was in respect of steeljoists). The applicants were accordingly told in February, 1926,that, "The Government have given careful consideration to thearguments advanced, but they are of opinion that the sameconsideration which debarred them from referring the largerapplication to a committee would, in fact, operate in regardto the sectional applications.11 I presume that I should inform the applicants that this decision still stands, P.C.-L,Board of Trade. 7til May, 1928.
